intro: Phyteuma tenerum subsp. ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in sunny habitats. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in Mediterranean regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
